name: dfcleqf
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1
body: |- wb(wceq(c0, c1), wal(s0, wb(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1))))

body.origin:
|- wb(wceq(c0, c1), wal(s0, wb(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1))))
-| wnfc(s0, c0)
-| wnfc(s0, c1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wceq(c0, c1), wal(s0, wb(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c1))))
-| wnfc(s0, c0)
-| wnfc(s0, c1)

comment: Equality connective between classes. Same as ~ dfcleq , using bound-variable hypotheses instead of distinct variable conditions. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 3-Mar-2021.)
